dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, I was just looking at the latest weather forecast from Kazhydromet, and it's looking pretty... *unstable* for the next few days across Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, I was just looking at the latest weather forecast from Kazhydromet, and it's looking pretty unstable for the next few days across Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazhydromet meteorologists have shared the weather forecast for June 17, 18, and 19 in Kazakhstan. A northwestern cyclone moving across most of the country will bring unstable weather: rain with thunderstorms and gusty winds are expected.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah? For June 17th, 18th, and 19th, right? I heard it's gonna be a bit of a mixed bag.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah? For June seventeenth, eighteenth, and nineteenth, right? I heard it's gonna be a bit of a mixed bag.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazhydromet meteorologists have shared the weather forecast for June 17, 18, and 19 in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Like, a northwestern cyclone is just sweeping across most of the country. So, expect rain, thunderstorms, gusty winds... all the fun stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Like, a northwestern cyclone is just sweeping across most of the country. So, expect rain, thunderstorms, gusty winds... all the fun stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A northwestern cyclone moving across most of the country will bring unstable weather: rain with thunderstorms and gusty winds are expected.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Mmm, and they're even talking about *heavy* rain and possibly hail in the northwest and north on the 18th and 19th. Not ideal for summer, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm, and they're even talking about heavy rain and possibly hail in the northwest and north on the eighteenth and nineteenth. Not ideal for summer, huh?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On June 18"19, heavy rain and possibly hail are forecast in the northwest and north of the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. And temperatures are gonna dip a bit there too, which, uh, is probably good with all that rain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. And temperatures are gonna dip a bit there too, which, uh, is probably good with all that rain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Northwest and North: A slight drop in nighttime temperatures is expected " from 17"25ÂC down to 15"23ÂC. Daytime highs will decrease from 25"35ÂC to 20"31ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a slight drop, like, down to 15-23 at night, and daytime highs going from like 25-35 down to 20-31.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a slight drop, like, down to fifteen to twenty three at night, and daytime highs going from like twenty five to thirty five down to twenty to thirty one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Northwest and North: A slight drop in nighttime temperatures is expected " from 17"25ÂC down to 15"23ÂC. Daytime highs will decrease from 25"35ÂC to 20"31ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, um, you look at the Central regions, and it's a completely different story. Intense heat! We're talking 35-39 degrees Celsius on the 17th and 18th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, um, you look at the Central regions, and it's a completely different story. Intense heat! We're talking thirty five to thirty nine degrees Celsius on the seventeenth and eighteenth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Central Regions: Nighttime temperatures will drop from 18"25ÂC to 15"22ÂC. On June 17"18, there will be intense heat with highs of 35"39ÂC

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, yeah, and in the southern parts of *that* region, they're even forecasting extreme heat up to 42 degrees! Just brutal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, and in the southern parts of that region, they're even forecasting extreme heat up to forty two degrees! Just brutal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: in the southern parts of the region, extreme heat of up to 42ÂC is forecast.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But luckily, by June 19th, it's expected to cool down a bit there, down to 27-32. So, a slight reprieve.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But luckily, by June nineteenth, it's expected to cool down a bit there, down to twenty seven to thirty two. So, a slight reprieve.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By June 19, temperatures are expected to decrease to 27"32ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whereas the East, um, they're actually seeing temperatures *rise*. Nighttime goes up, and daytime highs are hitting 35-39 degrees, with some areas even reaching 40 on the 19th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whereas the East, um, they're actually seeing temperatures rise. Nighttime goes up, and daytime highs are hitting thirty five to thirty nine degrees, with some areas even reaching forty on the nineteenth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: East: Nighttime temperatures will rise from 12"23ÂC to 17"25ÂC. Daytime highs will increase from 27"35ÂC to extreme heat of 35"39ÂC, and in some areas on June 19, up to 40ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the Southeast is pretty similar, looking at 35-39, even 42 degrees in some spots on the 18th and 19th. So, pretty intense summer conditions there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the Southeast is pretty similar, looking at thirty five to thirty nine even forty two degrees in some spots on the eighteenth and nineteenth. So, pretty intense summer conditions there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Southeast: A slight rise in nighttime temperatures is expected, from 18"23ÂC to 20"25ÂC. Daytime temperatures will reach 35"39ÂC, and on June 18"19, in some areas, up to 42ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: At least the South gets a break, right? From those crazy 43-46 degrees, it's gonna ease down to a much more manageable 30-38. That's, like, a huge relief.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. So, 'unstable' really is the operative word for the next few days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. So, unstable really is the operative word for the next few days.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And they also put out the forecast for the whole of June, and it's just gonna be this constant back and forth, right? Hot, cool, rain, heavy rain, thunderstorms, hail, dust storms... like, everything!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. So, basically, don't put away your winter coat or your swimming trunks, it seems.
